Weeks 4–5
The embryo now settles into 
your uterus lining. The outer cells 
reach out like roots to link with 
your blood supply. The inner 
cells	form	two	–	and	then	later	
three	–	layers.	Each	of	these	
layers	will	grow	to	be	different	
parts of your baby’s body. One 
layer becomes their brain and 
nervous system, skin, eyes and 
ears. Another layer becomes 
their lungs, stomach and gut.
